title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 202.31 - Identification of trial counsel
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 202.31 - Identification of trial counsel

State Regulations

Unless the court otherwise provides, where the
attorney of record for any party arranges for another attorney to conduct the
trial, the trial counsel must be identified in writing to the court and all
parties no later than 15 days after the pretrial conference or, if there is no
pretrial conference, at least 10 days before trial. The notice must be signed
by both the attorney of record and the trial counsel. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
202.31

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
